How does the CeVICA platform contribute: It integrates a synthetic Nb library with ribosome display and computational clustering to identify binders.
It uses a high-throughput screening method to rapidly test thousands of nanobody candidates.

What are the key advantages of using syn: Synthetic libraries avoid animal use, have shorter development times, and can target non-immunogenic or toxic antigens.
Synthetic libraries require less computational resources and have higher throughput screening capabilities.
Synthetic libraries are more cost-effective and have a higher yield of nanobodies per experiment.
Synthetic libraries produce nanobodies with inherently higher stability and solubility than immune libraries.
What challenge is associated with synthe: Synthetic libraries require large sizes to ensure sufficient diversity.
Synthetic libraries have a higher risk of cross-reactivity with non-target antigens.
Synthetic libraries are more prone to degradation during storage.
Synthetic libraries often produce nanobodies with lower solubility.
